Experts told ESM China that Amazon’s main battlefield is in North America and Europe, while 1688.com focuses on China’s B2B procurement and wholesale market. Chinese manufacturers are far from purchasing components through Amazon, although they will buy from Alibaba. The end-user population on Alibaba is not high, but sources point out that Alibaba is still valuable in the domestic component distribution market for spot dealers and traders which cannot find components through their own channels. They may find them on Alibaba. These traders typically buy and sell within a closed group and provide account services that allow small enterprises to enjoy privileges similar to large OEMs. These relationships tend to be very strong. Alibaba also has an advantage over professional electronic component and e-commerce platforms concentrated in the Yangtze River Delta and the Pearl River Delta region. Many mainland electronics companies, purchasers, engineers and research institutes are not familiar with these e-commerce platforms, but they will still buy through Taobao, Alibaba and other outlets. Avnet is committed to transforming the IoT market and has made several important changes to capitalize on IoT. Through cooperation with Alibaba Cloud, Chinese developers can accelerate IoT prototyping on a familiar, universal platform with built-in cloud connectivity and bring their Â IoT solutions to market faster than ever. Market headwinds All distributors are facing a tough market in 2019. Global trade tensions and tariff policy restrictions have become the biggest challenges for global distributors. Coupled with weakening Â end-user demand, distributors are facing more pressure on profitability than expected. Cost-cutting and spending control are the most direct and effective means of increasing revenue and profitability. In addition, distributors are exploring emerging application areas and innovative operating models. In this case, Avnet is cooperating with Alibaba to open an online super store.
